cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move west across the central Caribbean, then turn northwest toward the Cayman Islands, western Cuba, and eventually toward the Florida peninsula/Gulf of Mexico coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba (Isle of Youth or Pinar del Río province)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula and adjacent Gulf and Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force winds (39–57 mph) possible by late Tuesday night or Wednesday as the system crosses the peninsula.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Atlantic-side surge currently expected to remain below 3 ft, but minor coastal inundation and rough surf are possible during closest approach.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–6 inches of rain with localized higher amounts, leading to ponding and minor urban/port-area flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Space Coast; possible temporary channel restrictions or closure due to deteriorating seas.
